Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Jim] Hey, you ready?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, all right, secret sign. Hey, Ryan. [Ryan holds up his bag] Very good. Excellent, excellent.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Today at lunchtime we're going to be playing the warehouse staff at a friendly little game of basketball. My idea. Last time I was down there, I noticed they'd put up a couple of hoops, and I play basketball every weekend. So I thought, "This might be kinda fun." And so I started messing around and... I'm sinking a few, you know. Swish, swish, swish. Nothing but net. And their jaws just dropped to the floor. African-Americans! So... you know, it's really just a good friendly game, a reason to get together.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, Pam, thank you ma'am. Messages, please. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, can I talk to you, please? Privately? In your office? I think I should be on the team.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. And that's not me being mean, Dwight. That is based on your past behavior.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to camera] When I let him come to my pick-up game...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I apologized for that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Dwight] I vouched for you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, I...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I vouched for you in front of Todd Packer, Dwight. All right, here's what I'm going to do. The hand strikes and gives a flower. You are not going to play basketball. But I need somebody to come in and take over the holiday and weekend work calendar.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can handle that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. Excellent, it'll be fun. Because corporate, uh, wants someone to be here on Saturday. And so we're going to have to have some people come in on the weekend, and I know nobody's gonna want to do it and I know everybody's gonna complain and bitch and I don't want to have to deal with that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And that's why you have an assistant regional manager.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes it is. Assistant to the regional manager.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to camera] Same thing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, it's not. It's lower, so...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's close.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So we need someone to work this Saturday and I think that, that should be...Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: God, this is so sad. This is the smallest amount of power I've ever seen go to someone's head. Phyllis, can you believe this?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Keep me out of it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: My fiance has plans for us this Saturday. So I really hope that Dwight doesn't make me work. Maybe I should sleep with him? I'm kidding, kidding. Totally kidding.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, managing by walking around. This is our warehouse. Or, as I like to call it, the whorehouse. But don't you call it that, I've earned the right.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Fine, don't worry about that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And here we have "Mister Roger's Neighborhood." Come on over here. Hey, this is Ryan. He's temping upstairs.

Quote.Speaker: Lonny
Quote.Text: What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And this is the foreman. Mista Ra-jahs.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's not my real name.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, it's Darryl. Darryl is Mista Ra-jahs.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Darryl Rogers?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Darryl Philbin. Then Regis, then Rege, then Roger, then Mister Rogers.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs] And that is Lonny. And this is Roy. Roy dates Pam. You know, the uh, the best looking one upstairs.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You still getting it regular man? Huh? I mean, I can tell her it's part of the job! Rapport!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on the phone] No, no, I know that the warranty's expired, but isn't it supposed to last longer than two years if it isn't defective? OK, fine, three years.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam gets a little down. Her toaster oven broke. Um, which she got at her engagement shower. Um, for a wedding that still has yet to be set... and that was three years ago.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, um, one o'clock sharp and we've got a game on.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: We're loading at one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I see, you're chickening out on me. You're bailing on me.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No, we got a truck going out at 1:15. So, that's the busy time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, well, I'm glad that some time is a busy time because whenever I'm down here it doesn't seem too busy to me. Oh, oh. You can dish it out, but you can't take it. OK, fine, have it your way. [clucking and dancing like a chicken]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: All right, fine, you know what? One o'clock.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, see you at one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are we ready for the game?

Quote.Speaker: Everybody
Quote.Text: [half-heartedly] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I... yeah, yeah. I know, grumble, grumble. But you would follow me to the ends of the earth, grumbling all the way. Like that, uh, dwarf from Lord of the Rings.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Gimli.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nerd. That is why you're not on the team.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just trying to be helpful.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, [in a nerdy voice] "I'll help, Elwyn Dragonslayer, uh, ten points, power sword."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, so, let's put together a starting line-up, shall we? Stanley of course.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm sorry?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, what do you play? Center?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Why "of course"?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: What's that supposed to mean?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, I don't know. I don't remember saying that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, I heard it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, people hear a lot of things, man. Um... other starters... Me, of course. I heard it that time.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'd like to play if it's just for fun. I played basketball in school.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [ignores Phyllis)] Um... Yeah. Who else? We have Jim. We have Ryan, the new guy, right? Untested. Willing to prove himself now. A lot of passion, a lot of heart.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: But, I'm getting paid to skip lunch?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, this is business. The, uh, business of team building and morale boosting. Uh, who else?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I can help out, if you need me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will use your talents come baseball season, my friend. Or if we box.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I have a hoop in my driveway.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I have a sports bra.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, ridiculous.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, look. [Dwight throws paper at the garbage can]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Missed it...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Close. All right, uh... Me, Stan the man, Jim, Ryan and Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sorry Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can I be team captain?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I'm team captain.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can I be team manager?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I am the team manager. You can be assistant to the team manager.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Assistant team manager?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, we'll see who's working this weekend then.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim, you're in charge of the vacation schedule now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Threat neutralized.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [hits Pam in the head with a piece of paper] Off the backboard!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Please don't throw garbage at me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, Pam with a zinger. Hey, Pam, how would you, like to be our cheerleader today? You know, some, ah, pigtails? A little, ah, halter top, you could tie that up. And you know, something a little, just, youthful, for a change. Just this once?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think so Michael. Besides, I can't cheer against my fiance.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'll do it. Wear a little flouncey skirt if you want, and...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I bet you would. Just try not to be too gay on the court. And by gay I mean, um, you know, not in a homosexual way at all. I mean the uh, you know, like the bad-at-sports way. I think that goes without saying.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe Angela would cheerlead.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah right.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'll do it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, yuck, that's worse than you playing. ... 'Cause we need you as an alternate in case somebody gets hurt. That's where we need you. Blessed be those who sit and wait. You made it, suit up, you're on the team! All right, cool! Very good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh-oh. Oh-oh. A spy from the warehouse. Trying to figure out our plays, huh, man?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Just getting a tea bag.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh ho, oh, he's running. He's running. He's running, but he can't hide because you know what? One o'clock, you better bring your 'A' game. Because me, and my, posse guys are gonna be in your face. Right in your face!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Why don't we make it more interesting? Loser buys dinner at Farley's.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whoa-ho. I like the way you think. You know what, I'm gonna take that one step further. Loser, works, on Saturday.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No, that's not as much fun. You know what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You're on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK. Cool, you're on. [to Dwight] Don't screw this up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to camera] Classic beginner's mistake, eating before a game.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Has anyone seen the first-aid kit? [Dwight holds the kit up] How many times have I told you? I'm the safety officer, not you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Basketball? It was kind of my thing in high school. And I'm, yeah, I'm looking forward to playing. You know, I think I'm gonna impress a few people in here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You coming down?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm just forwarding the phones.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You gonna wish me luck?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, you're gonna need it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is that trash talk from Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughing] I'm just saying, Roy is very competitive.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And he wants to take the WaveRunners to the lake this Saturday so...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I'm going to the outlet mall on Saturday, so if you wanna save big on brand names and Roy has to work, which he will, because I'm also competitive, you should feel free to come along.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, I think I'm gonna be up at the lake.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think I'll see you at the mall. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, there he is! Secret weapon! All right, guys, come on, let's bring it in! Here we go! OK, listen, this is just going to be a friendly game, right? We are all on the same team here, the Dunder Mifflin team. Of course, if you beat us, you're fired. That's a joke. OK, let's do it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Have a good game man.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Yeah, you too. Should be fun.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, everybody stretch out a little bit. Stretch it. Full stretch. Ryan, you wanna stretch?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I stretched before I came.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, Ryan, you have Darryl. I have Roy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really? I thought I'd take Roy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Actually, I think Roy is their best player not Lonny. So, Dwight, you uh, have the East German gal. Uh, who else we got... Um...OK, all right, you guys.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [taking off his shirt] OK, we'll be skins!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Aw, come on Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What? Shirts on or off?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: On. Just put it on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You sure?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Uh, Pam? You kind of have your foot in both camps, why don't you do the uh, jump ball OK?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Don't listen to him Pam. Trust me, tip it my way or you're sleeping in the car.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stanley! What? You gotta be kidding me! !?! [Roy steals the ball, and goes for a lay up] Oh... Here we go! [Lonny shoots and makes it] Who's on him? Somebody get him!

Quote.Speaker: Teammates
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: That's what I'm talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah, yeah. Over here, over here. [Jim saves the ball from going out of bounds and passes to Michael] Here we go. Three! [Shoots and misses] Let's go to the zone! We're going to zone!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: De-fense! [clap, clap] [Michael joins in] De-fense! [clap clap]

Quote.Speaker: Michael and Dwight
Quote.Text: De-fense! De-fense!

Quote.Speaker: Warehouse Worker
Quote.Text: [Roy scores] Well done team.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who's got Roy? [Jim does a behind the back move around Roy for the basket]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Woo!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [misses a half court shot] Aw, come on! What is wrong with me today!? Usually hit those. [Dwight scores] Dwight, I was open. All right, let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Roy bumps Michael to get around him] OK, foul. Charging. Charging. That's a foul.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, I'll take it. [misses free throw] OK.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When I am playing hoops all of the stress and responsibility of my job here just melts away. It's gone, I'm in the zone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [misses another shot] What is wrong with me today?!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who am I? Am I Michael Scott? I don't know... I might just be a basketball machine. What's Dunder Mifflin? I've never heard of it. Filing? Paperwork? Who cares? Possible downsizing? Um... well, that's probably gonna happen, actually.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim! Jim! Jim, right here, Jim! Give me the ball! Ryan, cut! [Michael looks away and misses Jim's pass] Whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: My bad.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [scores] Here we go. Here we go. Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Lonny
Quote.Text: [dancing] Where you at? Where you at? You over there? I'm over there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is cool. Is that like the Robot?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Ryan scores] Nice! Come here! [gives Ryan a chest bump]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Can we just do one? That's cool, that's fine.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You have one more free throw shoot. Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: All right, let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Warehouse Worker
Quote.Text: Watch your back Madge.

Quote.Speaker: Madge
Quote.Text: Hey! Come on man!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on! Hey, Dwight. Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [scores] Yeah! [points to Madge] In your face!

Quote.Speaker: Madge
Quote.Text: Yeah, like that counts.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? Dwight, Dwight...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Football is like rock and roll, it's just bam-bam-boo... And basketball is like jazz, you know? You're kind of... Dupee-doo, dupee-do. It's all downbeat, it's in the pocket, it's like... [singing] Dupee-do, dupee-do, dapee-dah...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] Du-du-du-du-dupee-do, de-do-do-do. Du-du-du-du-dupee-do, de-do-do-do. Harlem Globetrotter...

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [steals the ball, scores, mimics singing] Du-du-du-du-dupee-do. Your ball.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, time, time out. Come on, sales, over here. Bring it in! Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's going on? What's going on? You're playing like a bunch of girls.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? Let me take Roy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, switch. Take it up a notch, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shoot, shoot it. [Roy hits Jim in the mouth with his elbow] Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa! Foul! Naked aggression! Oh, that is... You all right Jim? Suck it up.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Block, block, block!

Quote.Speaker: Madge
Quote.Text: He's afraid of you now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Jim makes a shot after pushing off Roy] Ouch! Oh, how much does it hurt? How much does it hurt?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Jim pushes Roy to the ground and makes another shot] Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: What the hell man?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Take it easy.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: No, you take it easy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Darryl scores] Watch the long passes, you guys!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [Dwight steals the ball from Ryan] Same team, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [scores] Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Phyllis scores] Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! In, your, face! Angela, what's the score?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You're ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, baby, here we go!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Jim has the ball] Jim! Jim! Right here! [runs into the elbow of the guy guarding him] Ow! God! Hold it!

Quote.Speaker: Worker
Quote.Text: I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Foul! Foul!

Quote.Speaker: Worker
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. You all right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, that hurts.

Quote.Speaker: Worker
Quote.Text: Sorry, I didn't mean to do that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's your problem man? Gah, just clocking me for no reason?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Take your shot man!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no. That was a flagrant, personal, intentional foul. Right there.

Quote.Speaker: Worker
Quote.Text: No it wasn't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [mocking voice] Yes, it was. You know what, I'm just being fair.

Quote.Speaker: Worker
Quote.Text: Oh, really? No, I just put my arm up...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Game over. Game over. That is it! I'm sorry, you know? I hate to do it this way but, you know, that's just... we're having a friendly game. It's a shame. This is a damn shame, but we're like a family here and that just, that won't fly.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: This is a cold pack...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Here, give me that. You have to break the interior bag. [bag explodes]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Lonny
Quote.Text: Wait, what does that mean? What is it, a tie? What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, let's just say whoever was ahead won.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That was you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It was us? Really? I didn't, I didn't know. Great, I mean, I guess you guys are working Saturday. Your face.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: No, no, no, I'm not coming in on Saturday.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, this isn't happening.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um... well, you guys, you know, I'm the boss so...

Quote.Speaker: Lonny
Quote.Text: So what's that? We're coming in on Monday, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, hey...

Quote.Speaker: Lonny
Quote.Text: Monday?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughing] You guys believed me? Come on. Dogs, you know, you should know me better than that. No, oh, do you think that would've been good for morale? No. No. No. Exactly, no. I'm embarrassed it was even that close though. So... nah, of course, we're coming in Saturday. Good game. Word.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Pam] ...so I talked to the scout, it looks good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I didn't sign anything.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Hey baby.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [to Jim] Look at Larry Bird. Larry Legend.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, he's, uh, pretty good, huh? [to Roy] Let's get you into a tub.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Yeah? Let's get you into a tub.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, what a game, huh? What a game.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What time do we have to come in?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on. Let's not be gloomy here man. We're all in this together. We're a team. You know what? Screw corporate, nobody's coming in tomorrow. You have the day off. Like coming in an extra day is gonna prevent us from being downsized. Have a good weekend.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The great thing about sports is that it is all about character. And you can learn lessons about life even if you don't win. But we did because we were ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [slams palms on desk] Pam, Pam, thank you ma'am. Messages, please. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: New pants?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, yes. Thank you for noticing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Abercrombie & Fitch?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, they look that good? Wow. [Mike Myers voice] Oh, Pam please behave. Mike Myers, genius. Um, no actually I got them at a fancier place. Target.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, could I talk to you for a second, please?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: In your office? [in Michael's office] You know that is why you have an assistant regional manager.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, yes. Assistant to the regional manager.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to camera] Same thing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, it's not. It's lower.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's close.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What was that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That look?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What look?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Like trying to find the camera, to give the camera a look. Okay, we're done. Is that your stomach? I keep hearing somebody's stomach. [whispers] God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, you uh, see the Sixers game last night?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [howls like a wolf] Oww whoo whoo! The Answer was on fire!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Iverson. Yeah, always man. It's very important.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, man! Man I tell ya. Iverson has maybe got me beat by like 20 pounds, 3 inches. [makes 'pop' noise with his mouth]

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: What? Iverson's not fat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, neither am I. We both look good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do I have a nickname on the court, um? Well, The Answer would be nice, but it's taken. So, uh, probably The Question. The Answer dishes to The Question. The Question back to The Answer. Answer over to The Question. The Answer, whew, [makes shooting motion] three points. The Question, whew, whew, [makes shooting motion] six points. Nothing but net. Question, who's the best player in the league? Answer, The Question. Or the Drunkmeister.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I can't work Saturday.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please, have a seat. [Kevin sits down] Okay, why not?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm in a band.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Marching or garage?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It's a Steve Miller Tribute Band.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I tell you what. You give me a tape of your band and a tape of the Steve Miller Band and I'll get back to you. That is all.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Mello.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Packer. Pac-man.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Whoa. Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pac-man [imitating the noises of the video game Pac-man eating dots]

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Is this Michael Scott? My secret lover. My intercom, I told you never to call me here. Never! [Michael's laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not your lover! I'm am not Michael Scott, I am Dr. Bergerstein. Your proctologist.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Bergerstein!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, yes. Ah. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Bergerstein!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's not a Jewish joke, so don't worry.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: [on the phone] I want my money back you greedy Hebrew. Bergerstein!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [clears throat] No, hey, hey , hey. You know what I just wanted to remind you about the game today. One 'o clock. Big game, big game.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: [sounds sick on the phone] I can't make it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm. No, you said you could man. We're counting on ya. You know you're playing point guard.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: [on the phone] I... I'm not coming.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. Hey... I mean, although it's just for fun, you know we want... I was counting on you man.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Oh, God! Stop whining. You know, you only come to the pick up game once a year. You little bitch. [Michael picks up phone, takes it off speakerphone] All right, yup. Hey, okay. No problem, you know, best you can do. Hey, you know. Hey, nice talking to you too. All right take care. [sighs] Michael Scoot. That's funny. He's a good friend.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [eating Tootsie Rolls from Angela's candy on her desk] Mmm. Good. Mmm.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: They're one per person. [points to sign "Please take one!!]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Would you like to have a vacation this year? That's what I thought. [continues eating Tootsie Rolls] Mmm, delicious.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, I though we were saving money for the wedding, but apparently Roy thought it was more important to buy two WaveRunners. I don't really ever get to use the other WaveRunner that's supposed to be mine because his brother uses it and they race.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim, you're the new schedule guy, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm trying, yup.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, I hear that. You know what? This little baby might come in handy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Great, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: On one condition. You...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Forget it. It's just a dry erase board.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, no it's not. Okay, check it out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, that's insanely complicated and the first thing I'm going to do is erase it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, you're not because I spent hours on it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, then keep it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, I will. Okay, fine. You'll be back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [misses a free throw badly] I... I think you can play. Like you could when you were a kid. I think you can never give up the play. Because if people stop playing, then they stop living. It's like a shark. If a shark stops playing he stops living. And sharks are very playful creatures.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [Dwight holds the first aid kit up] I'm the safety officer, not you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Isn't that crazy? I'm a Volunteer Sheriff's Deputy. Lackawanna County says that it's okay for me to perform CPR, but for Michael my lips aren't qualified enough for his perfect little face. It's nuts.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Is that really necessary?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [wearing a face guard] I've almost had my nose broken a dozen times.

Quote.Speaker: Warehouse Worker
Quote.Text: [back to the basketball game] Let's go Lonny.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Michael steals the ball] Yeah, Michael. Go Michael. [makes shot]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Birdie. He's not the guy with the cheeks. Kenny G. Is... if you knew jazz, you'd know who I mean. Kenny G. God. Glad I remembered that. Jazz people know who he is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [back to the basketball game] Dwight, pass it to Jim! Pass it to Ryan!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh, my ankle!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stanley, gotta play hurt.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh, actually no I don't Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I just want you know, you've been a big disappointment to me today, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [in pain] Oh. Go away.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm in. I'm in. Here we go. [Lonny gets around Michael to score and he ends up in front of Phyllis] Zone, Phyllis! We're playing zone!

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Kevin makes seven straight shots from the free throw line]

Quote.Speaker: Everybody
Quote.Text: [Michael hits a half court shot] Ah! [clapping]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes! Yes! All right. We got game!
